summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Dallas Veteran’s Affairs Commission will hold a regular meeting on March 14, 2024, at 12:00 PM at Dallas City Hall, 6ES Council Briefing Room, with a videoconference option available. The meeting aims to address veteran-related initiatives and organizational matters.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of the minutes from the February 8, 2024, meeting.
2. Presentation and discussion on the City of Dallas’ Veteran Needs Assessment.
3. Discussion on the creation of a Human Rights Commission.
4. Initiatives to increase awareness of veteran-serving organizations, including the introduction of a Veteran Serving Organizations Document and the Findhelp Portal.

**Important Details**:  
- Christina da Silva, WCIA Officer, will present on the Veteran Needs Assessment and the proposed Human Rights Commission, followed by a Q&A session.
- The commission will explore two new projects aimed at enhancing the visibility of organizations that support veterans.

**Action Items**:  
- Approval of the February meeting minutes.
- Engagement in discussions regarding the Veteran Needs Assessment and the establishment of a Human Rights Commission.
- Input and feedback on the initiatives to raise awareness of veteran-serving organizations.

The meeting will also announce the cancellation of the April 11 meeting due to the Welcoming America Conference. Participants wishing to speak must register 24 hours in advance.
